title.value: Оптимизация минерально-витаминного питания высокопродуктивных коров во 2-ю треть лактации при зимнем кормлении
Optimization of mineral and vitamin nutrition of high-performance cows during the 2nd third part lactation at winter feeding
Optimization of mineral and vitamin nutrition of high-performance cows during the 2nd third part lactation at winter feeding

journal.title: Zootechnical Science of Belarus: collection of scientific papers

person.name: Nevar, A.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)

abstract.value: The article presents the results of the effect of high doses of phosphorus, calcium, sodium, copper, zinc, cobalt, iodine, vitamin A and D for cows during the 2nd third part of lactation compared to the detailed standards for the winter feeding on milk performance, digestibility and assimilation of nutrients, blood biochemical indices and payment for feeds. The moderate increase of a level of normalized mineral substances and vitamins A and D, in particular phosphorus on 10,0% in comparison with excessive on 15,0% and an existing level in cows rations in 2nd third of lactation at winter feeding, promotes growth of milk (the standardized 4%-s' fat contents) yield on 5,46%, greater stability of a lactation with its course on 4,95, to improvement of organic substance digestibility in ration as a whole on 1,30%, to reception of the maximal profit on realization of additional
fat content 3,6%) on 4360 rbl. counting upon 1 goal. (in the prices 2012)
